trans-unit.source: In this section we will write a C app to send events to your event hub.
trans-unit.target: In this section we will write a C app to send events to your event hub.

trans-unit.source: We will make use of the Proton AMQP library from the [Apache Qpid project](http://qpid.apache.org/).
trans-unit.target: We will make use of the Proton AMQP library from the [Apache Qpid project](http://qpid.apache.org/).

trans-unit.source: This is analogous to using Service Bus Queues and Topics with AMQP from C as shown [here](https://code.msdn.microsoft.com/windowsazure/Using-Apache-Qpid-Proton-C-afd76504).
trans-unit.target: This is analogous to using Service Bus Queues and Topics with AMQP from C as shown [here](https://code.msdn.microsoft.com/windowsazure/Using-Apache-Qpid-Proton-C-afd76504).

trans-unit.source: For more information refer to [Qpid Proton documentation](http://qpid.apache.org/proton/index.html).
trans-unit.target: For more information refer to [Qpid Proton documentation](http://qpid.apache.org/proton/index.html).

trans-unit.source: From the [Qpid AMQP Messenger page](http://qpid.apache.org/components/messenger/index.html), click the **Installing Qpid Proton** link and follow the instructions depending on your environment.
trans-unit.target: From the [Qpid AMQP Messenger page](http://qpid.apache.org/components/messenger/index.html), click the **Installing Qpid Proton** link and follow the instructions depending on your environment.

trans-unit.source: We will assume a Linux environment, e.g. an [Azure Linux VM](../articles/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-linux-tutorial.md) with Ubuntu 14.04.
trans-unit.target: We will assume a Linux environment, e.g. an [Azure Linux VM](../articles/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-linux-tutorial.md) with Ubuntu 14.04.

trans-unit.source: To compile the Proton library, install the following packages:
trans-unit.target: To compile the Proton library, install the following packages:

trans-unit.source: Download the [Qpid Proton library](http://qpid.apache.org/proton/index.html) library, and extract it, e.g.:
trans-unit.target: Download the [Qpid Proton library](http://qpid.apache.org/proton/index.html) library, and extract it, e.g.:

trans-unit.source: Create a build directory, compile and install:
trans-unit.target: Create a build directory, compile and install:

trans-unit.source: In your work directory, create a new file called **sender.c** with the following content.
trans-unit.target: In your work directory, create a new file called **sender.c** with the following content.

trans-unit.source: Remember to substitute the value for your event hub name and namespace name (the latter is usually `{event hub name}-ns`).
trans-unit.target: Remember to substitute the value for your event hub name and namespace name (the latter is usually `{event hub name}-ns`).

trans-unit.source: You must also substitute a URL-encoded version of the key for the **SendRule** created earlier.
trans-unit.target: You must also substitute a URL-encoded version of the key for the **SendRule** created earlier.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] In the code above, we use an outgoing window of 1 to force the messages out as soon as possible.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] In the code above, we use an outgoing window of 1 to force the messages out as soon as possible.

trans-unit.source: In general your application should try to batch messages to increase throughput.
trans-unit.target: In general your application should try to batch messages to increase throughput.

trans-unit.source: Refer to [Qpid AMQP Messenger page](http://qpid.apache.org/components/messenger/index.html) for more information on how to use the Qpid Proton library in this and other environments, and from platforms for which bindings are provided (currently Perl, PHP, Python, and Ruby).
trans-unit.target: Refer to [Qpid AMQP Messenger page](http://qpid.apache.org/components/messenger/index.html) for more information on how to use the Qpid Proton library in this and other environments, and from platforms for which bindings are provided (currently Perl, PHP, Python, and Ruby).
